zoom dragging DocuSign down today. Now the key is zoom gave weaker then expected guidance. I believe this will not be the case with Docusign. I think Docusign will give stronger guidance. We shall see. I am seeing more and more docusign agreements in my daily dealings and it has nothing to do with Covid. Its just easier, efficient reduces time and cost.
Going back to 300 soon,400 next year, 2031 will be $3000

Wow, very inactive board. Soon, people will realize the value here and DOCU will lose it's monicker as a "work from home stock". NO successful business would EVER go back to physical signature after utilizing an eSign service. And DOCU offers a slew of other products.

Docusign puzzles me. They have a dominant position in a fast growing market (digital documents and contracts)yet they flutter. I believe it is only a matter of time before this stock doubles in value. The growth rate is too high and the TAM is also massive.
wow just filled an order at 251.20 for 5k shares didn't believe it would really fill 3 weeks ago when I put it in

If you’re a true DOCU investor it doesnt matter if the price is 200 or 400, im not selling. Huge potential. Would actually love to add shares again in low 200’s or lower but i doubt we’ll get the chance again.. maybe

Met revenue guide at Earnings Whispers and crushed EPS:Docusign (DOCU) reported 2nd Quarter July 2021 earnings of $0.47 per share. The consensus earnings estimate was $0.39 per share on revenue of $487.5 million. The Earnings Whisper number was $0.42 per share.The company said it expects third quarter revenue of $526.0 million to $532.0 million. The current consensus revenue estimate is $520.62 million for the quarter ending October 31, 2021. The company also said it expects fiscal fiscal revenue of $2.078 billion to $2.088 billion. The company's previous guidance was revenue of $2.027 billion to $2.039 billion and the current consensus revenue estimate is $2.05 billion for the year ending January 31, 2022.

Z and $ZG own Dotloop, which is the equivalent of $DOCU. With DOCU having a $54B market cap and Z half that you have to wonder what a sum of the parts of Z and ZG might be worth. Some companies with a larger market cap than Affirm's $38B: Coca Cola $KO, Starbucks $SBUX, TJMaxx $TJX, Docusign $DOCU, Ross Stores $ROST. Affirm is scaling their volume by about 2 X per year without purchasing inventory or real estate or fulfillment centers. Own Quality.
